title: What is relationship between geology and engineering geology? - Quora

response.answer_text: Geology is the study of the Earth. This includes everything from the origin of the earth to the various speculations in the future. It covers a wide range of subjects and theories. Engineering geology is an applied discipline of geological studies. It aims at applying the knowledge of geology to smoothly conduct and to sustain civil engineering structures. Engineering geologists are not civil engineers. They don’t design buildings, bridges or dams but they study the geology of the area (rock type, soil type, slopes, foundation problems and solutions, hazard management and so on). So, here you go: Geologists study the rocks, soils, geomorphic features, faults and folds. Engineering geologists study all these topics from the perspective of engineering constructions.
Geology is almost theoretical subject and Engineering Geology is all about applications of subject knowledge and solutions of geological problems on particular project. Happy Learning :)
